text: {| class="wikitable collapsible floatright" style="font-size:89%" ! colspan="2" style="white-space: nowrap;" | Asteroids discovered: 40 |- | 12061 Alena || March 21, 1998 |- | 12533 Edmond || June 2, 1998 |- | || September 18, 1998 |- | 13436 Enid || November 17, 1999 |- | 13688 Oklahoma || September 9, 1997 |- | (14165) 1998 UZ || October 19, 1998 |- | || April 5, 2000 |- | 15904 Halstead || September 29, 1997 |- | || November 6, 1997 |- | || July 14, 1999 |- | || September 13, 1999 |- | || September 13, 1999 |- | || September 27, 2000 |- | (24095) 1999 VN || November 2, 1999 |- | || November 12, 1999 |- | (25357) 1999 TM || October 1, 1999 |- | || October 19, 1998 |- | (27219) 1999 EL || March 9, 1999 |- | || February 19, 1999 |- | || February 24, 1998 |- | (33431) 1999 EK || March 9, 1999 |- | || November 25, 1997 |- | || January 29, 1998 |- | (40171) 1998 RS || September 11, 1998 |- | (44474) 1998 WE || November 16, 1998 |- | || November 23, 1998 |- | || November 4, 1999 |- | || November 12, 1999 |- | || November 12, 1998 |- | || November 11, 1998 |- | || September 29, 1997 |- | || January 23, 1998 |- | || December 21, 2000 |- | (70426) 1999 TN || October 1, 1999 |- | || November 8, 1999 |- | || September 30, 1999 |- | || November 30, 1999 |- | || November 15, 1999 |- | || November 7, 1997 |- | || February 4, 2000 |} Tom Stafford is an American astronomer who has discovered a number of asteroids since 1997, including 12061 Alena, 12533 Edmond, 13436 Enid, 13688 Oklahoma and 15904 Halstead at Zeno Observatory (observatory code 727) in Edmond, Oklahoma. He is the son of Joseph W. Stafford and Alena Ruth Robbins, both now deceased, and has a sister, Susan Halstead. == References == Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:American astronomers Category:Discoverers of asteroids Category:People from Edmond, Oklahoma
title: Tom Stafford (astronomer)
